User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the MultaMind application, including their subscription details.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity, matching the Firebase Auth UID.

planStatus.description: The current status of the user's subscription.

billingInterval.description: The billing frequency for the subscription.

currentPeriodEnd.description: Timestamp for when the current billing period ends.

cancelAtPeriodEnd.description: If true, the subscription will be canceled at the end of the current period.

graceUntil.description: A timestamp indicating when access should be revoked if payment isn't received.

userMemory.description: A long-term summary of user preferences and key information.

Session.title: Session
Session.description: Represents a user session, storing the user ID and optionally the ID token (though the ID token should be short-lived and handled carefully).

id.description: Unique identifier for the Session entity.
Unique identifier for the Chat session.

userId.description: The UID of the user who owns this chat.

title.description: The title of the chat session.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the chat was created.

chatMemory.description: A running summary of the current chat session.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a single message within a chat.

chatId.description: The ID of the chat this message belongs to.

content.description: The text content of the message.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the message was created.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to manage user data, chats, and messages. It prioritizes security by nesting user-owned data (like chats) under a user-specific document. This path-based ownership simplifies security rules and ensures a user can only access their own data, preventing them from listing or accessing data belonging to other users.
